subject: Education
title: Prison Literacy: Reading Behind Bars
description: A quick win: understand Prison Literacy: Reading Behind Bars.

hook.text: 75% of U.S. state prison inmates cannot read above a fourth-grade level. Illiteracy and crime are linked.

buildup.text: Low literacy is one of the strongest predictors of incarcerationâ€”stronger than poverty alone.

discovery.text: Prison literacy programs reduce reoffending by 43%, making them one of the most cost-effective interventions.

twist.text: Despite the evidence, many prisons are cutting education budgets and banning books from inmates.

climax.text: Programs like 'Books Behind Bars' and prison book clubs are transforming inmates into readers and writers.

punchline.text: Teaching a prisoner to read costs far less than keeping them locked up.

quiz.question: How do prison literacy programs affect reoffending rates?
